name: Arora Hotel Heathrow

reviews.text: I stayed at the hotel when working in the Heathrow area on the 21st June, the hotel was of a very good standard in comparison to many alternatives in the Heathrow area. Check in was very efficient and by friendly informative staff.
reviews.title: High Quality Airport Hotel - Keep up the Good work!!

reviews.text: Once I arrived at my room I found it to be of a very high standard, and immaculately clean, much better than I had expected for a 4* Airport hotel. There was also a pleasant bar are with a happy hour, and large screen TV's and pool table.
reviews.title: comfortable and safe

reviews.text: The food was the only disappointment, as it was not of a very high quality for the money, the burger i had was overcooked and the chips were not fantastic.
reviews.title: Does what it says on the tin...

reviews.text: The hotel also has a very convenient little shop inside where you can buy drinks and snacks at reasonable prices (including some nice Indian treats in the fridge).
reviews.title: just what you need

reviews.text: To avoid paying a high taxi fare at Heathrow, use the local buses which are frequent and serve the hotel free of charge (Heathrow free travel zone). These are easy to locate particularly from T5.
reviews.title: Modern Hotel, ideal for a night before or after a flight

reviews.text: need to get the reception trained in how the barrier works, and what to do to monitor ,when called for HELP....other wise its ok,,,
reviews.title: everything went well, till I could not get out of the car park

reviews.text: a little hard to find if not familiar with area, but easy bus access!
reviews.title: Excellent accommodations - easy access to Heathrow. Comfy bed!

reviews.text: I've stayed here twice, generic decor but great soundproofing, comfortable, clean, good food & helpful staff. Reasonably priced & free regular buses to Heathrow. I don't have high expectations for airport htoels, but this place very much surpassed my expectations. It seems to get used by lots of cabin crew, usually a good sign!
reviews.title: Excellent for an airport hotel

reviews.text: It was just a stopover to connect to a local transport after a long haul flight. The hotel was very inexpensive comparing to London standards but to a surprize The hotel was very quite and neat for a good night rest. Sleep quality was amazing. A really convenient place for a brief stay.
reviews.title: short and comfortable stay

reviews.text: A high quality hotel, where cleanliness is clearly a priority for the management - rooms very well equipped and very clean. Comfy bed.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel but restaurant pricey

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Arora is a hotel at which one typically stays for one night and one might forgive the staff if they were a bit off-hand - however, very much to the contrary, in our experience of 2 or 3 stays we have found them all to be very pleasant and welcomingl. I don't know whether this is selection or training, but it does make a short stopover that much more pleasant!
reviews.title: A hotel with exceptionally pleasant staff!

reviews.text: We stayed here the night before our flight from heathrow. It's less then 10 mins with a taxi to heathrow and it will cost about £10 to get there. Room is very clean and spacious. Internet access is available but it's wired and quit expensive. The restaurant in the hotel is good but not cheap and not too much choice. Overall good value when you need to stay a night near heathrow
reviews.title: Excellent value for money

reviews.text: Have stayed here a few times and the location is very convenient.
reviews.title: Nice option while at heathrow

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is centrally located thus making it easy to travel to any of heathrow’s 5 terminals.
reviews.title: What a brilliant Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Being in the free travel zone area,many of the buses are free to travel on,compared to the hotel hoppa which turned out to be a bit steep while travelling with family.The bus stop is called Compass center and is very close to the hotel.
reviews.title: good value, excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Arora, Heathrow before flying out the next day.
reviews.title: Great Airport Hotel

reviews.text: It was one of the best "airport hotels" that we've stayed at Heathrow.
reviews.title: Best Hotel at Heathrow

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As we arrived at the hotel, our bags & cases were put on a trolley by the staff, who then took them up to our room. The check in was very friendly, helpful, quick and efficient.
reviews.title: Great hotel close to the airport

reviews.text: Our room was on the 3rd floor, although hotel is very close to the airport there was no noise at all. The room was very comfortable and clean. Tea, Coffee and a large flat screen tv all in the room. Bathroom was of a reasonable size with bath & shower.
reviews.title: An ok hotel ruined by arrogant staff

reviews.text: We had breakfast in the morning. A "help yourself" style breakfast and the food was very good.
reviews.title: Clean, Reasonable and Convenient overnight stopover.

description: Situated in the heart of Heathrow, overlooking the North runway, Arora Hotel Heathrow is only a stone’s throw away from Heathrow Airport, with free transfers to terminal 1, 2, 3, terminal 4 as well as terminal 5 by public transport. This 4 star hotel features 350 Superior and Premier accommodation bedrooms, meeting facilities for up to 100 delegates and an exclusive top floor boardroom, Restaurant and Bar, a 24-hour gym as well as on-site car park.
